FuncDef:
The ptp mac-egress command configures MAC encapsulation parameters for PTP packets (excluding those transparently transmitted) to be sent on a specific interface.
The undo ptp mac-egress destination-mac command restores the MAC multicast encapsulation mode.
The undo ptp mac-egress vlan command restores the default virtual local area network (VLAN) ID and priority value for the packets.
By default, a PTP device uses the MAC encapsulation mode to send untagged PTP packets with priority 7 to a multicast address.
CLIs: undo ptp mac-egress { destination-mac | vlan [ priority ] }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a destination MAC address for PTP packets.
The value is in the format of H-H-H. Each H indicates one to four hexadecimal digits. The destination MAC address can only be 01-80-C2-00-00-0E or 01-1B-19-00-00-00 under G.8275.1 mode.. By default, the destination MAC address is 01-1B-19-00-00-00 under G.8275.1 mode.

Specifies a VLAN ID for PTP packets.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies the priority value for PTP packets.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7. The default value is 7. A larger value allows for a higher priority.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
You can encapsulate PTP messages into Layer 2 and Layer 3 packets and set the destination address and transmission priority.
An encapsulation mode depends on a specific link type:
Layer 2 links: The ptp mac-egress command configures the MAC encapsulation mode.Layer 3 links: The ptp udp-egress command configures the UDP encapsulation mode.
Specify a destination MAC address as needed:
Specify a destination MAC address if unicast MAC encapsulation is used.Use a default destination MAC address if multicast MAC encapsulation is used. The addresses 01-1B-19-00-00-00 (for all except peer delay measurement mechanisms) and 01-80-C2-00-00-0E (for peer delay measurement mechanism) are default multicast MAC addresses when specific delay measurement mechanisms are used.
This command applies only to 1588v2, G.8275.1 and CU-106.

Prerequisites
A delay measurement mechanism has been specified using the ptp delay-mechanism { delay | pdelay } command.
PTP has been enabled on an interface using the ptp enable command.
Precautions
1588v2 services need higher priority than other services. A high transmission priority minimizes the delay or congestion impact on clock signal recovery. Using the default highest priority is recommended. In G.8275.1 mode, only multicast MAC encapsulation is supported.
